overview.tax_residency_rules: Determined by 183-day rule or permanent home in Croatia.

personal_income_tax.exemptions: Basic exemption of 46,946 HRK (amount may vary each year).
personal_income_tax.social_security: 12.5% of salary (shared between employer and employee).

capital_gains_tax.exemptions: Sale of primary residence after 10 years of ownership is exempt.

vat_gst.reduced_rate: 13% on certain items, including food, beverages, fuel, medication.

property_tax.rate: Property tax rates vary by municipality.
property_tax.exemptions: Primary residence may be eligible for exemptions.

inheritance_tax.rate: 3 - 15% on inherited assets, depending on the relationship to the deceased.
inheritance_tax.exemptions: Close relatives may be eligible for exemptions.

special_economic_zones.name: Free Zone Rijeka
special_economic_zones.tax_incentives: Reduced corporate tax rate, import/export duty exemptions.

double_taxation_agreements.description: Avoids double taxation on income and certain types of gains.

crypto_tax.capital_gains_rate: 0% on long-term capital gains held for more than a year.

nft_tax.capital_gains_rate: 0% on long-term capital gains held for more than a year.

additional_notes.political_risks: Political stability and tax laws are generally stable.
additional_notes.economic_stability: Croatia is a member of the European Union and has a relatively stable economy.
additional_notes.legal_system: Tax laws are enforced efficiently, and the legal system is reliable.
additional_notes.ease_of_doing_business: Ranked 51st in the World Bank's Ease of Doing Business Index.
